Insurers, financial advisers offer an arm to lean on through struggles of reopening ...  plans is key Nanette Nocon of Nocon & Associates in Rochester. (Photo: provided) The dramatic downturn in the economy and the uncertainty about how the pandemic will affect people's jobs creates a similar cloudy landscape in the financial industry. It's not so much the short-term losses in the stock market that have people worried. It's how the pandemic may be impacting their long-term plans. Nanette Nancon, an adviser with Ameriprise Financial Services in Brighton, says that for many of her clients, those comprehensive financial plans will need to be re-evaluated. "The markets have not been favorable, and that has required that we reach out to more clients," Nancon said. "We have to ask, 'What will the impact of market decline ...

Look Out Democrats, The Economy Is Looking Better For Trump Than You Think ...  may be banking on the dire economy to ensure a landslide victory in the fall election. But that hope may soon evaporate as we enter the summer. Economic Bounce Back This Summer What probably matters more for many voters is what will happen in the few months before the November election, not the current situation. And that could surprise the world. Ameriprise Financial AMP and Nomura Securities International both see an annualized growth rate of 30% in the three months through September, according to the WSJ survey. Another 10 similar institutions, such as CSFB, Scotiabank BNS and Natwest Markets, forecast the economy will expand by between 20% and 30%. Other institutions see lower rates of growth and perhaps even continued contraction. The average growth ...
